MMCIF_ITEM GetCategoryID ()

void Optimize ()
 Optimizes structure for RAM and data access speed. Optimized data structures take less RAM and their indexes are sorted for quicker access. Sorting is done automatically as new data is added to the category. If the structure is edited (fields/data removed), it may need optimization and re-sorting for efficiency.

The sorting preserves the order of actual appearance of tags in mmCIF file. If a structure is created programmatically, the order of tags in mmCIF file will be the same as order of adding them to the structure.

Detailed Description

mmcif::Struct represents mmCIF's "structure" category, where data follows directly the corresponding tag.

mmCIF's "structure" category has the following form: 

    _structure_name.tag0   value0
    _structure_name.tag1   value1
    ...........
    _structure_name.tagN   valueN

mmcif::Struct represents this construct by keeping category name ("_structure_name") and associated lists of tags ("tag0,tag1...tagN") and their values ("value0,value1...valueN").

The structure is created automatically when an mmCIF file is read, or it may be created programatically and then pushed into file.

Access to data is provided via tags. Internally, all values are kept as character fields, and it is only on the retrieval stage that they are converted to other data types (integers, floats or strings). If conversion is not possible, an error code is returned by the corresponding functions, which should be checked by the application.

See general principles of working with mmCIF files and mmCIF hierarchies, as well as some code samples, in Section "mmcif_handler".

void mmdb::mmcif::Struct::AddField ( cpstr  F,
cpstr  T,
bool  Concatenate = false 
)

Adds field to the structure.

Parameters:
[in]Ffield value
[in]Ttag name
[in]Concatenateflag to concatenate existing field with the value of F. If tag T is already in the structure and Concatenate=true, then value of F is appended to the existing field. Otherwise, the field is replaced with the value of F
void mmdb::mmcif::Struct::Copy ( PCategory  Struct ) [virtual]

Deep copy of structures. Deep copy duplicates all data and memory allocations, producing a genuine clone of the original. Only deep copy should be used for copying MMDB objects, a mere assignment operator will fail you.

Parameters:
[in]Structa pointer to mmcif::Struct, the content of which is copied into 'this' structure.

Reimplemented from mmdb::mmcif::Category.

pstr mmdb::mmcif::Struct::GetField ( int  tagNo )

Returns value of field corresponding to tag in the specified position. Tag positions are defined by the order of their appearance in mmCIF file (if structure was read from a file), or by the order of their addition to the structure (if structure was created programmatically). Tags are numbered as 0...GetNofTags()-1.

Parameters:
[in]tagNotag number (position in the structure)
Returns:
NULL: tag does not exist
CIF_NODATA_DOT_FIELD the field contains "data not given" value
CIF_NODATA_QUESTION_FIELD the field contains "data not available" value
not NULL: string value of the field
int mmdb::mmcif::Struct::GetInteger ( int &  I,
cpstr  TName,
bool  Remove = false 
)

Fetches value, corresponding to the given tag, as an integer number.

Parameters:
[out]Ireference to integer number to accept the value. In case of failure, I returns zero, except when value is "data not available" or "data not given", when I returns MinInt4.
[in]TNamecharacter string with tag name
[in]Removeflag to remove the tag and its value from structure after it is read.
Returns:
  • CIFRC_NoTag: tag is not found
CIFRC_NoField: field is not found
CIFRC_WrongFormat: value is not an integer number.
CIFRC_NoData: value is either "data not available" or "data not given".
CIFRC_Ok: success.
int mmdb::mmcif::Struct::GetReal ( realtype &  R,
cpstr  TName,
bool  Remove = false 
)

Fetches value, corresponding to the given tag, as a real number.

Parameters:
[out]Rreference to real number to accept the value. In case of failure, R returns zero.
[in]TNamecharacter string with tag name
[in]Removeflag to remove the tag and its value from structure after it is read.
Returns:
CIFRC_NoTag: tag is not found
CIFRC_NoField: field is not found
CIFRC_WrongFormat: value is not a real or integer number.
CIFRC_NoData: value is either "data not available" or "data not given".
CIFRC_Ok: success.
int mmdb::mmcif::Struct::GetString ( pstr &  S,
cpstr  TName,
bool  Remove = false 
)

Fetches value, corresponding to the given tag, as a string.

Parameters:
[out]Spointer to string, which will point to newly allocated character string, containing value associated with tag TName. If tag or value is not found, or if value corresponds to mmCIF's "data not given" or "data not available", S returns NULL.
[in]TNamecharacter string with tag name
[in]Removeflag to remove the tag and its value from structure after it is read.
Returns:
CIFRC_NoTag: tag is not found
CIFRC_NoField: value is not found
CIFRC_Ok: success. If S returns NULL, then the value corresponds to either "data not available" or "data not given".
Remarks:
If S!=NULL at time of call, the function will try to dispose the string it points on. This allows a slick re-use of the same pointer in consequitive calls. This also means that one should never pass unallocated pointer to this function. Safe use assumes the following patern: 
  mmcif::Struct mmCIFStruct;
  pstr S;  // this is merely "char *S"
  int  rc;

    S  = NULL; // null pointer before first use
    rc = mmCIFStruct.GetString ( S,"id" );
    if (rc)  CreateCopy ( S,"*** data not found" );
    if (!S)  CreateCopy ( S,"*** data not given or not available" );
    printf ( " rc=%i, S='%s'\n",rc,S );

    rc = mmCIFStruct.GetString ( S,"property" );
    if (rc)  CreateCopy ( S,"*** data not found" );
    if (!S)  CreateCopy ( S,"*** data not given or not available" );
    printf ( " rc=%i, S='%s'\n",rc,S );

    // etc etc etc

    delete[] S;  // application is responsible for final
                 // disposal of memory
pstr mmdb::mmcif::Struct::GetString ( cpstr  TName,
int &  RC 
)

Returns pointer to value associated with given tag.

Parameters:
[in]TNamecharacter string with tag name
[out]RCreturn code:

  • CIFRC_NoTag: tag is not found
  • CIFRC_NoField: value is not found
  • CIFRC_Ok: success. If function returns NULL, then the value corresponds to either "data not available" or "data not given".
Returns:
NULL: either tag or value is not found, or the value is "data not available" or "data not given". Read return code RC in order to interpret NULL return.
not NULL: pointer (char *) to value associated with TName.
Remarks:
Never try to dispose memory pointed by the return value, or your program will crash.
void mmdb::mmcif::Struct::InitStruct (  ) [protected]
void mmdb::mmcif::Struct::Optimize (  ) [virtual]

Optimizes structure for RAM and data access speed. Optimized data structures take less RAM and their indexes are sorted for quicker access. Sorting is done automatically as new data is added to the category. If the structure is edited (fields/data removed), it may need optimization and re-sorting for efficiency.

The sorting preserves the order of actual appearance of tags in mmCIF file. If a structure is created programmatically, the order of tags in mmCIF file will be the same as order of adding them to the structure.

Reimplemented from mmdb::mmcif::Category.

Parameters:

cpstr  T 
)

Sets "data not given" or "data not available" values for given tag.

Parameters:
[in]NoDataTypecan be either

  • CIF_NODATA_DOT for "data not given"
  • CIF_NODATA_QUESTION for "data not available"
[in]Tcharacter string with tag name. If tag is not found, it will be added to the structure.

[in]precfloat-point precision; g-format with given precision will be used

void mmdb::mmcif::Struct::PutString ( cpstr  S,
cpstr  TName,
bool  NonBlankOnly = false 
)

Sets string value for given tag.

Parameters:
[in]Scharacter string with value to be set. If S==NULL, the "data not given" value will be set. If S=="" (empty string), the "data not available" value is stored.
[in]TNamecharacter string with tag name. If tag is not found, it will be added to the structure.
[in]NonBlankOnlyflag to treat white-space-only strings:

  • false: set as is
  • true: set "data not available" value instead.

void mmdb::mmcif::Struct::WriteMMCIF ( io::RFile  f ) [virtual]

Writes structure into given file.

Parameters:
freference to MMDB's file class. The file should be opened and closed by application.
Remarks:
There is a very limited use of this function on application level. It is primarily used by mmcif::Data class.

Reimplemented from mmdb::mmcif::Category.

bool mmdb::mmcif::Struct::WriteMMCIFStruct ( cpstr  FName,
io::GZ_MODE  gzipMode = io::GZM_CHECK 
)

Writes structure data in mmCIF format into file.

Parameters:
[in]FNamecharacter string with file name.
[in]gzipModeflag to controll compression of files:

  • GZM_NONE: do not compress
  • GZM_CHECK: check file name suffix and compress (or not) accordingly
  • GZM_ENFORCE_GZIP: force gzip compression despite suffix
  • GZM_ENFORCE_COMPRESS: force using compress despite suffix
Returns:
true: success
false: can not open file for writing.
Remarks:
This function does not create a valid mmCIF file as "data_XXX" record will be missing. It may be used for debugging though.
